{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3498226,"name":"Owen Flanagan","username":"OwenF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/edb3f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T20:22:54.630Z","cooked":"

Ive been trying to write some code that looks at a list of possible poses and finds the one that can be reached quickest. My original idea was to do this with pathplanner but from my understanding path planner doesn’t actually calculate the path immediately. Instead, saves the end point and recalculates the current path every once in a while on its own update cycle. This is a problem since I want to calculate a lot of paths without waiting around for pathplanner to update its cycle each time. Is there a way to get around that waiting or a different method I should try?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T20:22:54.630Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":81.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484500,"topic_slug":"finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points","display_username":"Owen Flanagan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65469,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Code Lead"},"post_url":"/t/finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points/484500/1","custom_user_title":"Code Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3498230,"name":"Joey Tidrow","username":"Arrowmag","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arrowmag/{size}/233870_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T20:25:23.105Z","cooked":"

Why do you want to find which one you will reach the fastest? Could you not just calculate the distance to find the closest one and that one should be the fastest one.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T20:25:23.105Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":55.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484500,"topic_slug":"finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points","display_username":"Joey Tidrow","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59796,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1646M 2851A "},"post_url":"/t/finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points/484500/2","custom_user_title":"1646M 2851A ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3498260,"name":"Owen","username":"Owen4026","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen4026/{size}/211145_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T20:41:23.923Z","cooked":"

You could technically have a situation where your robot is traveling at some velocity that would make it faster to reach a pose that isn’t the closest, because of the time it would take to decelerate.

In practice, I doubt this would occur often and I don’t think you would lose much time just going for the closest pose. I think just finding the pose that is the shortest distance from your robot pose is probably a good enough solution here.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T20:41:23.923Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":23.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484500,"topic_slug":"finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points","display_username":"Owen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":59796,"username":"Arrowmag","name":"Joey Tidrow","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arrowmag/{size}/233870_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63229,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points/484500/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3498283,"name":"Owen Flanagan","username":"OwenF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/edb3f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T20:55:56.199Z","cooked":"

The primary issue with this is obstacles. Because of those getting distance is a lot more complex then just applying the pythagorean theorem to the points. If i need to do somthing fully custom its prob what ill end up doing but i would rather avoid a custom pathfinder if I can.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T20:55:56.199Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":24.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484500,"topic_slug":"finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points","display_username":"Owen Flanagan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":59796,"username":"Arrowmag","name":"Joey Tidrow","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arrowmag/{size}/233870_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65469,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Code Lead"},"post_url":"/t/finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points/484500/4","custom_user_title":"Code Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3498329,"name":"Joey Tidrow","username":"Arrowmag","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arrowmag/{size}/233870_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T21:27:33.273Z","cooked":"
Owen4026:

You could technically have a situation where your robot is traveling at some velocity that would make it faster to reach a pose that isn’t the closest, because of the time it would take to decelerate.

This can be compensated for by adding the velocity multiplied by some small scalar value to the current pose and then finding the closest based on that.

OwenF:

The primary issue with this is obstacles. Because of those getting distance is a lot more complex then just applying the pythagorean theorem to the points.

If this is for the reef then this should not be the case but can be solved by just checking if the line of sight will hit any obstacles or only allow it to drive to only some points based on its pose on the feild.

OwenF:

If i need to do somthing fully custom its prob what ill end up doing but i would rather avoid a custom pathfinder if I can.

You can try Pathplanner and its built-in pathfinder. It works pretty well from my testing and avoids obstacles on the field

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T21:27:33.273Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":59,"readers_count":58,"score":46.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":484500,"topic_slug":"finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points","display_username":"Joey Tidrow","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59796,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1646M 2851A "},"post_url":"/t/finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points/484500/5","custom_user_title":"1646M 2851A ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3498339,"name":"Owen Flanagan","username":"OwenF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/edb3f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T21:34:01.828Z","cooked":"

We are using pathplanner for the actual pathplanning but i’m worried that it wont work for the time finding because of when it generates the paths. Additionally we want to be able to get the time for poses that arn’t in LOS since that is a pretty significant portion of the field.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T21:34:01.828Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":49,"readers_count":48,"score":19.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":484500,"topic_slug":"finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points","display_username":"Owen Flanagan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":59796,"username":"Arrowmag","name":"Joey Tidrow","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arrowmag/{size}/233870_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65469,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Code Lead"},"post_url":"/t/finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points/484500/6","custom_user_title":"Code Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3498362,"name":"Joey Tidrow","username":"Arrowmag","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arrowmag/{size}/233870_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T21:45:35.483Z","cooked":"

Why do you want to do time-finding? If it is only for scoring on the reef there are other ways you can do it that don’t require re-calculating the closest point based on time. Position with some velocity factor should get you pretty close to the point with the lowest time without needing heavy loads of computing. Also, you only have to calculate based on which alliance you are on and not do it for every point in the full field.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T21:45:35.483Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":46,"readers_count":45,"score":44.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484500,"topic_slug":"finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points","display_username":"Joey Tidrow","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":65469,"username":"OwenF","name":"Owen Flanagan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/edb3f5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59796,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1646M 2851A "},"post_url":"/t/finding-the-fastest-pose-to-reach-from-a-list-of-points/484500/7","custom_user_title":"1646M 2851A ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3498449,"name":"Owen Flanagan","username":"OwenF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/edb3f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T23:26:13.185Z","cooked":"

The reason I want time is because the robots actually deciding on points per second of the route, not just the fastest route per second.
